articles.author: Emily Rose, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israel struck multiple targets in Lebanon on Sunday, pressing Iran-backed Hezbollah with more attacks after it struck a huge blow by killing the group's leader, Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah.
articles.title: Israel pounds Lebanon, pressuring Hezbollah after killing its leader

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Parisa Hafezi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Hezbollah faces the enormous challenge of plugging the infiltration that allowed Israel to destroy weapons sites, booby-trap its communications and assassinate the veteran leader.
articles.title: Nasrallah's killing reveals depth of Israel's penetration of Hezbollah

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: Austrians elect a new parliament on Sunday with the far-right Freedom Party (FPO) aiming to secure its first general election win in a neck-and-neck race with the ruling conservatives that has been dominated by economic worries and immigration.
articles.title: Austria holds tight election with far right bidding for historic win

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi said the U.S. deployment of intermediate-range missiles in the Philippines "undermines regional peace and stability", the foreign ministry said on Sunday.
articles.title: China says US missile deployment in Philippines undermines peace

articles.author: Gopal Sharma
articles.description: Nepal has shut schools for three days after landslides and floods triggered by two days of heavy rain across the Himalayan nation killed 100, with 67 missing, officials said on Sunday.
articles.title: Nepal closes schools after heavy rains kill 100

articles.author: Borja Suarez
articles.description: Rescue crews on Sunday renewed the search for about 48 migrants missing since their boat capsized near the Spanish island of El Hierro in what threatens to be the deadliest such incident in 30 years of crossings from Africa to the Canary Islands.
articles.title: Search renews for missing migrants after nine die off Spain's Canary Islands

articles.author: Gram Slattery
articles.description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump will hold a rally in Pennsylvania on Sunday, his fourth campaign stop in a month in what has become arguably the 2024 campaign's most hotly contested state.
articles.title: Donald Trump, anxious for a win in Pennsylvania, to hold rally in Erie

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Sunday that amendments to Russia's nuclear doctrine had been prepared and were about to be formalised, meaning the relevant documents setting out the circumstances in which nuclear arms can be used by Moscow will be updated.
articles.title: Kremlin says Russia's updated nuclear doctrine is being formalised

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanon's Information Minister Ziad Makary said during a cabinet session on Sunday that diplomatic efforts for a ceasefire with Israel were underway.
articles.title: Diplomatic efforts for ceasefire with Israel underway, Lebanese minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's parliament speaker Mohammad Baqer Qalibaf said on Sunday that militant groups would carry on confronting Israel with Tehran's help following the killing of Hezbollah chief Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah, Iranian state media reported.
articles.title: Iran's parliament speaker says militant groups will go on confronting Israel
